title: bonsai 0.2.1
text: recent dials parsnip releases introduced tuning integration lightgbm num_leaves engine argument! num_leaves parameter sets maximum number nodes per tree, important tuning parameter lightgbm (tidymodels/dials#256, tidymodels/parsnip#838). newest version dials, parsnip, bonsai installed, tune argument marking num_leaves engine argument tuning defining model specification: Fixed bug lightgbm’s parallelism argument num_threads overridden passed via param rather main argument. default, , lightgbm fit sequentially rather num_threads = foreach::getDoParWorkers(). user can still set num_threads via engine arguments engine = "lightgbm": Note , tuning hyperparameters tune package, detection parallel backend still work usual. boost_tree argument stop_iter now maps lightgbm:::lgb.train() argument early_stopping_round rather alias early_stopping_rounds. affect parsnip’s interface lightgbm (.e. via boost_tree() %>% set_engine("lightgbm")), though introduce errors code uses train_lightgbm() wrapper directly sets lightgbm::lgb.train() argument early_stopping_round alias early_stopping_rounds via train_lightgbm()’s .... Disallowed passing main model arguments engine arguments set_engine("lightgbm", ...) via aliases. , main argument marked tuning lightgbm alias supplied engine argument, bonsai now error, rather supplying lightgbm allowing package handle aliases. Users can still interface non-main boost_tree() arguments via lightgbm aliases (#53).
code: boost_tree() %>% set_engine("lightgbm", num_leaves = tune()) boost_tree() %>% set_engine("lightgbm", num_threads = x)

title: bonsai 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-08-31 Enabled bagging lightgbm via sample_size argument boost_tree (#32 tidymodels/parsnip#768). following docs now available ?details_boost_tree_lightgbm describe interface detail: sample_size argument translated bagging_fraction parameter param argument lgb.train. argument interpreted lightgbm proportion rather count, bonsai internally reparameterizes sample_size argument [dials::sample_prop()] tuning. effectively enable bagging, user also need set bagging_freq argument lightgbm. bagging_freq defaults 0, means bagging disabled, bagging_freq argument k means booster perform bagging every kth boosting iteration. Thus, default, sample_size argument ignored without setting argument manually. boosting libraries, like xgboost, analogous argument bagging_freq use k = 1 analogue bagging_fraction (0,1). bonsai thus automatically set bagging_freq = 1 set_engine("lightgbm", ...) sample_size (.e. bagging_fraction) equal 1 bagging_freq value supplied. default can overridden setting bagging_freq argument set_engine() manually. Corrected mapping mtry argument boost_tree lightgbm engine. mtry previously mapped feature_fraction argument lgb.train documented mapping argument closely resembling feature_fraction_bynode. mtry now maps feature_fraction_bynode. means code set feature_fraction_bynode argument set_engine() now error, user can now pass feature_fraction set_engine() without raising error. Fixed error lightgbm engine argument objective = "tweedie" response values less 1. number documentation improvements, increases testing coverage, changes internals anticipation 4.0.0 release lightgbm package. Thank @jameslamb effort expertise!
